channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VT

item.title: Report X-2023040498
item.description:
Report X-2023040498

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T09:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-03
  • City: SOUTH BURLINGTON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to the scene when package was discovered to be leaking, before being loaded into a delivery van. Package was pulled to the side and safely contained in a hazmat bin and brought to the QA Cage. DescribePack: many of the cans were bent, but one was found to be leaking from the bottom corner, which is the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contained in a hazmat bin, brought to the QA Cage

item.title: Report E-2023030778
item.description:
Report E-2023030778

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T09:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: ROCKINGHAM
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 53ft-by-5ft area of the trailer floor and a 5ft-by-5ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that approximately thirty (30) gallons of product was released. Hepaco personnel neutralized the impacted areas and used granular absorbents to collect the material. The damaged metal drum containing approximately twenty (20) gallons of remaining product was overpacked into an 85-gallon poly drum. The spent absorbents and debris were placed into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING DUE TO WET SPOT ON CORNER OF BOX. STATION QA WAS NOTIFIED AND PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED AND PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT BIN. DescribePack: LID ON METAL DRUM IS BULGING (HARD TO CAPTURE CLEARLY IN PHOTOS). UNCLEAR HOW THIS HAPPENED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: STATION QA WAS NOTIFIED AND PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED AND PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT BIN.

item.title: Report I-2022120311
item.description:
Report I-2022120311

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-18
  • City: HARTFORD
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROSS EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Ross forklift operator was loading freight to a trailer and one drum of four drums on a wooden pallet when the forklift operator noticed liquid leaking from one of the drums to terminal concrete floor. It was determine a forklift fork speared the drum when the freight was picked up by the forklift. It was determined 55 gallons of product leaked out of the drum. The forklift operator immedicately notified a supervisor who with the dock crew reviewed what the product was and established containment of the product. The dock crew contained the spill then proceeded to safely isolate the drum and dtermining it was safe to start cleanup of the product, placing the hazadous material material in a recovery drum. The damaged drum and product was sent to NH terminal for it to be disposed of.

item.title: Report I-2022090284
item.description:
Report I-2022090284

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-06
  • City: HARTFORD
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROSS WELDING SUPPLIES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ROSS FORKLIFT OPERATOR WAS UNLOADING FREIGHT IN THE TRAILER AND ONE DRUM OF FOUR DRUMS ON A WOODEN PALLET APPEARED TO HAVE A DAMAGE WOODEN PALLET UNDER THEM. THE FORKLIFT OPERATOR CAUGHT/PUNCTURED THE DRUM WITH A FORKLIFT FORK WHILE TRYING TO GET UNDER THE WOODEN PALLET AND A LEAK OCCURRED. THE FORKLIFT OPERATOR BACKED OUT OF THE TRAILER REMOVING ALL IGNITION SOURCES AND CHECKED THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE GUIDE BOOK ON PROPER HM CLEANUP. THE DOCK EMPLOYEE WAS DIRECTED TO HAVE THE TRAILER MOVED AWAY FROM THE BUILDING ON PAVEMENT AND AWAY FROM ANY WATER DRAINS AND WATER SOURCES. THE TRAILER REAR DOOR WAS OPENED TO VENTILATE TO THE OUTSIDE, DUE TO THE STRONG SMELL AND CONTAINED THE SPILL BY PLACING SPEEDY DRY PRODUCT ON THE TRAILER FLOOR TO ABSORB THE ACCESS PRODUCT THAT HAD SPREAD ON THE TRAILER FLOOR. LATER IN THE DAY THE ASST. SUPERVISOR WITH HELP FROM A DRIVER WAS ABLE TO GO INTO THE VENTILATED TRAILER TO UPRIGHT THE DRUM WITH EXCESS PRODUCT STILL IN THE DRUM AND PLACE THE BLUE PLASTIC 55 GALLON DRUM INTO A 95 GALLON RECOVERY DRUM. ALL THE CLEANUP SUPPLIES USED WERE PLACED ALSO IN A LARGE YELLOW 95 GALLON RECOVERY DRUM FOR DISPOSAL. PRODUCT IS BEING VENTILATED AS IT IS BEING PREPARED FOR DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2022070084
item.description:
Report X-2022070084

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-02
  • City: WHITE RIVER JUNCTION
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 12 X 32 OUNCE CANS OF FLAMMABLE ALL WEATHER PVC CEMENT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM VERMONT USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 1244EA, GREEN MOUNTAIN ELECTRIC SUPPLY, 356 RATHE RD., COLCHESTER VT 05446.
